JobFullDesc: Raytheon Technologies (RIS) is seeking a highly motivated engineer to serve as a program Software Quality Engineer providing complete life-cycle support to large-scale software and systems integration programs at our Aurora, CO location.The Software Quality Engineer will ensure the quality and success of delivered hardware, software, and related documentation. Additional responsibilities include but are not limited to:Review contract Statements of Work (SOW) and Intelligence Information & Services IIS Enterprise Process Information Center (EPIC) changes and ensure content is integrated into program plans and tracking systems Interface with customer representatives Interface with program management, engineering, development, integration and test teams Provide proposal inputs including: labor bids with justifiable task descriptions / bases of estimates Review program and contract Quality requirements and flow to Suppliers and/or Subcontractors; review and approve Supplier and Subcontractor test procedures and test results Review and ensure program plans, procedures, Raytheon Technologies policies, and contract compliance documents for consistency and Statements of Work (SOW) satisfaction. Develop, review, and approve program Quality Plans, Subcontractor Statements of Work (SOWs), Contract Data Requirements List (CDRLs), Subcontractor Data Requirements List SDRLs, etc. Schedule and perform program internal audits and impartial evaluations to verify compliance and effectiveness with program processes Participate in program team meetings, peer reviews, technical reviews, and formal reviews, such as Gate reviews and program milestone reviews Regularly participate (identify, review, mitigate) in program risk and opportunity process Guide program Corrective Actions Gather, analyze and draw conclusions from metrics Review and approve internal acceptance test plans, procedures and test automation Conduct pre- and post-test environment configuration audits, ensure discrepancies are resolved, and witness acceptance and qualification testing Monitor tests, review test results (unit test, system test, regression test) and ensure issues are addressed Support delivered system Installations Perform Hardware Inspection tasks including assembly of racks and components as well as inspection of multi-conductor cabling per drawings and or prints Perform Supplier Quality tasks to include reviewing incoming supplies and products from vendors to check for defects and ensure quality Maintain reports on supplier quality to include defect rates and areas that result in flaws Provide QNotes in support of Purchase Requisitions/Orders Lead Lessons Learned and Root Cause Analysis efforts.  U.S. Citizenship required as the candidate must have an Active U.S. Top Secret Clearance with SSBI day one of employment.  Required Skills Six years’ experience with multi-discipline, Software or System Developments Multi-discipline, including Software, Quality Engineering experience throughout the complete program life-cycle Knowledge of Quality Management Systems and compliance Excellent communication and presentation skills Demonstrated ability to perform autonomous assessments and evaluations Gather, analyze and draw conclusions from metrics Demonstrated ability to effectively interface with internal/external customers, subcontractor personnel and program stakeholders. Desired Skills Experience and certification in Agile and Development, Security, and Operations (DevSecOps) Methodologies Experience in system engineering, developing, integrating and testing software, including Commercial Off the Shelf (COTS) integration and test automation American Society for Quality (ASQ) Certification Six Sigma Certification Auditing experience Operational experience with command and control ground systems Company-specific Mission Assurance certification Experience with collaborative development environments  Experience with cloud computing Knowledge of AS9100/ISO 9001 Experience with Institute of Printed Circuits (IPC620) Workmanship Standards Earned Value Management Certification  Required Education Bachelor of Science Degree in Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics Bachelor of Art Degrees in an appropriate field of science (Computer Science, Chemistry or Physics) Bachelor of Art Degree in Mathematics   Desired Education For the Bachelor of Art Degrees listed above, ABET is the preferred, although not required, accreditation standard
